title: How to Empty and Clean Any Dyson Vacuum Cleaner

steps.content: Press the red button on the nozzle attachment and remove it from the canister. Hold the canister over a trash can or a large plastic bag. Then, just pull the red lever on the top of the canister straight up to open the bottom and release the dirt inside. Close the hatch on the bottom so it clicks. [1] X Research source For additional cleaning, press the red tab on the buttons where the vacuum base connects to pull out the filter. Then, press the red tab on the bottom of the canister to take it off the base. Wipe inside the canister with a damp cloth to pick up any leftover dust.

Press the red release button where the wand connects to the base of the vacuum and remove it. Hold the vacuum canister over a trash bag, and hold onto the red lever under the handle. Push the lever straight down to open the bottom of the canister and empty out any dirt and dust. Close the hatch and slide the canister up to lock it back in place. [2] X Research source If you want to do a deeper clean, press the red release tab on the canister to slide it off of the vacuum base. Wipe the inside with a damp cloth, let it dry, and then reinstall it on your machine.

Press the red tab where the vacuum wand connects to the base. Hold the canister over a trash can so it’s pointing down. Press on the red release tab near the middle of the canister to slide it down and open the hatch. Once all the dirt and debris falls into the trash, push the bin upwards and snap the hatch closed. [3] X Research source Press the red tab on the back of the canister to completely remove it from the base for a more thorough cleaning. Wipe the inside with a damp cloth, let it dry, and then slide it back onto your vacuum.

Hold the Dyson vacuum canister over your trash can. Push the red button on the side of the canister to open the bottom hatch. Give the canister a few shakes to remove all the dirt and dust before closing the hatch. [4] X Research source When the canister is open, look for a red release button under the handle. Press the button to remove the canister and wipe out any leftover dust with a damp cloth. Once the canister dries, replace it back on the vacuum base. [5] X Research source

Press the red wand release button where it connects to the vacuum’s base and pull it out. Hold the bottom of the canister over a trash can. Hold down the red release lever on the side of the canister to slide it down and open the hatch on the bottom. Once you empty your Dyson, slide the canister back up and close the hatch so it clicks into place. [6] X Research source

Look for the red release button on the top of the vacuum’s handle, and press it down to remove the canister. Hold the canister over your trash can and press down on the red button on its side. When the canister slides down, the hatch opens to release all the dirt and dust. When you’re finished, close the hatch and push the canister until it clicks. Then, place the canister back into your vacuum. [7] X Research source

Find the gray canister release button near the vacuum’s handle and press it down. Hold the canister over your trash can, and push down on the red button on top to open the bottom hatch. Give the canister a few shakes to get rid of the debris before closing the hatch again. [8] X Research source If dust is stuck inside the canister, press the gray button on its side to remove the top. Wipe the inside of the canister with a damp, lint-free cloth and let it dry. Then, slide the pieces back together and put them back on the vacuum’s base.

With your Dyson vacuum in the locked, upright position, press down on the red button at the top of the canister’s handle. Hold the canister over your trash bin, and press down on the red release tab again to open the hatch. Shake the dirt out of the canister before closing the hatch and reinstalling it on your vacuum. [9] X Research source These instructions work for any Dyson upright vacuum, including the Cinetic Big Ball, DC50, and DC40.

Press the red button on the vacuum wand and pull it off of the base. Hold the canister over your trash can and press down on the red button on the side. Slide the canister down to open the hatch and empty your vacuum. Then, close the hatch and slide the canister up until it clicks into place. [10] X Research source To clean the vacuum more, push the red tab on the canister to the side to remove it from the base of the machine. Wipe the inside out with a damp cloth, let it dry, and reattach it to your machine.

Press the red release button at the top of the vacuum’s bin and lift it up to remove it. Hold the bin over your garbage can and slide the red release button on the handle forward to empty the bin. Wipe the inside of the canister out with a damp cloth and let it dry before reattaching it to the vacuum base. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Press the release button down completely.
steps.content: Press the release button down completely. If you only press the release button down partially, then the bottom of your Dyson canister will not open properly. Push or slide the release button fully to force the canister open. [12] X Research source If your Dyson bin is still stuck closed and won’t open, then you may need to replace it. Visit the Dyson support site , find your vacuum model, and order a new bin.

steps.title: Remove and rinse the filter under cold water.
steps.content: Remove and rinse the filter under cold water. The filter location depends on the Dyson vacuum model you have, but they’re usually found near the top of the canister and can easily be pulled out. Alessandra Mendes, a cleaning specialist, says to “rinse it with cold water until the water runs clear. Make sure you don’t use soap or place it in any kind of washing machine as it will damage your filter. Gently squeeze the water out and allow it to air dry completely before using it again.” Regina DeCorte, a residential cleaning specialist, recommends cleaning the filters on a regular monthly schedule to keep your vacuum running properly.
